page.title: 04Changing Times - Road
page.content: From 1939-1956 the only dual carriageway was from the Post Office down to Dalmakether road end. In 1956 this was extended to the south past Dinwoodie. In the early 1960s the whole length of the road was made into a dual carriageway. In 1982 the roads and bridge were widened .An access road to the houses in the village was made up at the back of the village and a fence erected up the front at the side of the carriageway. A few weeks ago a crash barrier was erected up the middle of the road from the bridge to the filing station. It will be extended further soon.
